intro: Habenaria tenuicaulis, commonly known as the slender-stemmed marsh orchid, is a herbaceous perennial native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies, thriving in moist to wet soil conditions. The plant features a slender, often匍匐 (prostrate) stem and produces small, greenish or white flowers arranged in a raceme. Its leaves are linear and grass-like, and it is known for its ability to tolerate waterlogged environments. Botanically, it belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its simple, non-showy floral structure.
